nl.tudelft.simulation.dsol.animation.D2

Class Renderable2DInterface.Util

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.tudelft.simulation.dsol.animation.D2.Renderable2DInterface.Util
  • Enclosing interface:
    Renderable2DInterface<T extends nl.tudelft.simulation.dsol.animation.Locatable>

    public static class Renderable2DInterface.Util
extends java.lang.Object
    A Utility helper class for transforming between screen coordinates and world coordinates.
    (c) 2002-2018 Delft University of Technology , the Netherlands.
    See for project information www.simulation.tudelft.nl
    License of use: Lesser General Public License (LGPL) , no warranty.
    Version:
    1.0 Mar 1, 2004
    Author:
    Peter Jacobs

    • Method Detail

      • getScale

        public static double getScale(java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D extent,
                              java.awt.Dimension screen)
        returns the scale of a screen compared to an extent. The scale can only be computed if the xScale and yScale are equal. If this is not the case, Double.NaN is returned. In order to overcome estimation errors, this equality is computed with Math.abs(yScale-xScale) < 0.005 * xScale. If the height or the width of the screen are < 0 Double.NaN is returned.
        Parameters:
        extent - the extent
        screen - the screen
        Returns:
        double the scale. Can return Double.NaN

      • computeVisibleExtent

        public static java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D computeVisibleExtent(java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D extent,
                                                             java.awt.Dimension screen)
        computes the visible extent.
        Parameters:
        extent - the extent
        screen - the screen
        Returns:
        a new extent or null if parameters are null or screen is invalid (< 0)

      • getScreenCoordinates

        public static java.awt.geom.Point2D getScreenCoordinates(java.awt.geom.Point2D worldCoordinates,
                                                         java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D extent,
                                                         java.awt.Dimension screen)
        returns the frame xy-coordinates of a point in world coordinates. If parameters are invalid (i.e. screen.size < 0) a null value is returned. If parameter combinations (i.e !extent.contains(point)) are invalid a null value is returned.
        Parameters:
        worldCoordinates - the world coordinates
        extent - the extent of this
        screen - the screen
        Returns:
        Point2D (x,y) on screen. Can be null

      • getWorldCoordinates

        public static java.awt.geom.Point2D getWorldCoordinates(java.awt.geom.Point2D screenCoordinates,
                                                        java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D extent,
                                                        java.awt.Dimension screen)
        returns the frame xy-coordinates of a point in screen coordinates. If parameters are invalid (i.e. screen.size < 0) a null value is returned. If parameter combinations (i.e !screen.contains(point)) are invalid a null value is returned.
        Parameters:
        screenCoordinates - the screen coordinates
        extent - the extent of this
        screen - the screen
        Returns:
        Point2D (x,y) on screen
